javaly.core

Class SysOutInvoker

  • java.lang.Object
    • javaly.core.SysOutInvoker

  • public class SysOutInvoker
extends java.lang.Object
    SysOutInvoker allows you to invoke methods that print to the standard output while also catching runtime exceptions that may occur during the execution.

    It requires you to specify the class, the method and the parameters you wish to pass to the method. All output from this class is meant to be directly passed to the assertEquals method.

    Usage is as below:

    Let's say your question expects a student to define the following function

    public class Adder {public static void add(int a, int b){System.out.println(a + b);} }

    You would have the following Test class: 

     
 import static javaly.core.Test.*;
 import static javaly.core.SysOutInvoker.*;
 public class AddTest{
  public static void main(String[] args){
    assertEquals("3", invokeAndGetSysOut(Adder.class, "add", 1, 2));
    assertEquals("0", invokeAndGetSysOut(Adder.class, "add", 0, 0));
    assertEquals("-1", invokeAndGetSysOut(Adder.class, "add", 1, -2));
    printResults(); //check whether the test cases are correct before submission to javaly
  }
 }

    Or more generally: 

     
 import static javaly.core.Test.*;
 import static javaly.core.SysOutInvoker.*;
 //other import statements
 ...

 public class AddTest{
  public static void main(String[] args){
    //prep code
    ...
    assertEquals(expectedString, invokeAndGetSysOut([nameOfClassToTest].class, nameOfMethodToTest, param1, param2, ...));
    ...
    printResults(); //check whether the test cases are correct before submission to javaly
  }
 }

      static java.lang.String invokeAndGetSysOut(java.lang.Class<?> clazz, java.lang.String methodName, java.lang.Object... params)

    • Method Detail

      • invokeAndGetSysOut

        public static java.lang.String invokeAndGetSysOut(java.lang.String className,
                                                  java.lang.String methodName,
                                                  java.lang.Object... params)
        Invokes the given method of the given class and returns the String containing the contents of the standard output.
        Parameters:
        className - Name of the user written class to be tested with its package hierarchy.
        methodName - Name of method that needs to be invoked (that prints to standard output).
        params - Parameters that are used by the method to be invoked.
        Returns:
        A String containing the result of the execution.

      • invokeAndGetSysOut

        public static java.lang.String invokeAndGetSysOut(java.lang.Class<?> clazz,
                                                  java.lang.String methodName,
                                                  java.lang.Object... params)
        Invokes the given method of the given class and returns the String containing the contents of the standard output.
        Parameters:
        clazz - A Class object of the user written class to be tested
        methodName - Name of method that needs to be invoked (that prints to standard output).
        params - Parameters that are used by the method to be invoked.
        Returns:
        A String containing the result of the execution.
